utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: She screamed as the pain ripped through her and in between each labored breath she thought “there is no way in hell I’m having this baby on a subway train in the Bronx”.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Did you get all that?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: So you actually gave birth to your son on the Metro?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: No … she didn’t. She also didn’t run a marathon the night before she had me or beat up a mugger while 9 months pregnant.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s called dramatic license, darling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it’s called wild exaggeration. Dramatic license applies to writing.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And that’s what I’m doing. This is Marcus, the fabulous young playwright I told you about who’s helping me put together my one woman show.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I’m a huge fan. Just being in this office is a dream come true.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For me too. For me too. Only in my dreams, I’m usually by myself.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: We just felt that this room had the best creative ju-ju.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it does. It does. I wrote 20 best sellers in here.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d like to write another one. Now.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, can’t it wait dear? We’re putting the final touches on Act 1. You know, where I overcome the challenges of being a single working mother –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know you’re writing a work of fiction, right? Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: First Alexis is interning for Lanie. Thank you. Now my mother is taking over my office? I feel like my whole life is being invaded.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ll get used to it. I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is not the same thing. ‘kay, it’s similar. Just much less invasive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie. So what do we got here?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: That’s a good question. I can tell you this much – based on body temp and lividity our victim died between 10 and midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Claw marks? She was attacked by an animal?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, she was running from something. She’s got dirt on her feet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What animal in Central Park could maul a person to death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m not even sure that’s what happened. These lacerations look shallow, nonlethal, but I won’t know exactly what killed her until I get her back to the morgue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have an ID?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No wallet or purse, so we don’t know who she’s is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t it obvious? Am I the only one seeing this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Red cloak, in the woods, animal attack.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s Little Red Riding Hood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great, Castle. I’ll call in an APB for the Big Bad Wolf.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have a better theory?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan? Do you think you could call dispatch, see if there are any reports of a violent animal running around the park?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Like a wolf? A big bad one?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That is exactly how I pictured her. It’s freaky. My older sister used to read me that story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, when you’re done reliving your childhood memories do you also think you can canvass the area for witnesses and anyone that might know her name? And I bet you it’s not gonna be Little Red Riding Hood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “All the better to eat you with. No sooner had the wolf said these words when he leaped up and gobbled down poor Little Red Riding Hood.” Well, the good news is the wolf can talk, so if we can find him we might be able to get a confession.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, except in the wolf doesn’t kill Little Red Riding Hood. The huntsman cuts her out of the wolf’s stomach and then she kills the wolf.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone’s a Brothers Grimm fan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah. They didn’t sugarcoat it. They understood that fairy tales are pretty much horror stories.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Which is why we all need them to grapple with the unknown. Which is why they tap into our primal fears, like being alone in the woods or getting eaten by monsters.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They’re not horror stories. They’re life lessons. If you do the right thing you get to live happily ever after.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But only in fairy tales.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Speaking of fairy tales, turns out that our victim really was Red Riding Hood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you drinking Castle’s Kool-Aid now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, she was actually wearing a Red Riding Hood costume. It said so in the label.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, okay. So then why was she wearing it in the middle of the woods at night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On her way to grandmother’s house.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmm… I doubt it. Grandmother lives in Tallahassee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh great, so you got an ID?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Her prints popped in the DMV database. Her name is Amy Morgan. Her sister Leslie is on her way in.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE MORGAN
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Are you saying Amy was attacked by some kind of animal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do either of you have any idea why she was in the park?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Amy never went there. She didn’t had time. She was too busy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doing what?

utterance.speaker: DARREN THOMAS
utterance.content: She was an attorney for Samson Briggs in litigation. They worked her like, a hundred hours a week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she have a boyfriend? Anyone she would have been with last night?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Amy’s single. She lives alone. She’s very driven. Was. She was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do either of you know why she would be wearing this?

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: What is it? A cape?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a Red Riding Hood cloak.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: She was wearing that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: I know Amy’s closet. This was not hers. I mean, even her sweatpants were Prada.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe she was going to a party. Did she mention any parties?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: I’m telling you. She would never wear a thing like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Leslie, did your sister ever tell you about anything unusual going on at work, or in her personal life?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I hadn’t heard from her all week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was that out of the ordinary?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Yes. We usually talked every day and when she didn’t call I just assumed she was busy with a case or something, but … maybe there was something else going on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Thank you. So that was Ryan. He just left Animal Control and there was only 1 recent report of an animal loose in the park. A beagle. Named Fred.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well either Fred is one vicious beagle or this mystery has just deepened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does a high-powered lawyer end up dead in a Red Riding Hood costume? Amy worked long hours under pressure, right? What if she had a secret way of letting off steam that even her sister didn’t know about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s this whole … adult role playing subculture obsessed with fairy tales.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not – not that kind of adult role play. Although, there is that one too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you know this … how?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did a little research. Huh. Bo Peep. Anyway, these people get dressed in the outfits, they play the characters, they even reenact the stories. Maybe that’s what Amy was doing when everything went horribly and tragically wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that is a surprisingly reasonable and grounded theory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Frankly, I’m a little disappointed in myself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We all are, bro. So, I was going over Amy’s financials for any unusual activity. 4 days ago she took out $50,605 dollars from her savings, all in cash.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: $50,605? That’s an odd amount for a withdrawal, especially in cash.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, not only that, but the $50k? It’s not in her apartment and I can’t tie it to any recent purchases.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Contact her bank, see if they know why she made that withdrawal.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As you wish.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … Lanie’s got news for us.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, I’ve got news all right, but I’m not sure you’re gonna like it. I found hairs like this one in a wound on the victim’s arm. It didn’t come from her, so I ran DNA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did we get a match?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The hair isn’t human. It’s wolf hair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooooh!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Simmer down, Castle. I’m not done with the story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. What’s the rest of it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, from the depth and the length of the gashes it looks like the marks were made by only one claw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A one legged wolf?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t think it’s a wolf at all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the hair and the claw.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer wanted us to think it was a wolf to throw us off.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Which would explain why there are no bite marks on the body. The gashes were inflicted by a human killer using a wolf claw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then what’s the real cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, I found two fresh needle marks, both on the victim’s back, so she didn’t put them there herself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she was drugged? Was there any signs of sexual assault?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, but tox results turned up ketamine and oxycodone. I’m thinking our guy sedated her with the ketamine then dressed her in the costume. But the dose didn’t quite knock her out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she tried to run away from her killer -

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And when he caught her he dosed her with oxy and it was lights out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The drugs, the claw? This is murder, planned and premeditated. I mean, the killer staged the crime scene to evoke images of Little Red Riding Hood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m less concerned about why. What I’m wondering is who.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer must have lured Amy into the park.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he’s someone that she knew and trusted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Like Red Riding Hood trusted her cute little Granny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Ryan, what did Amy’s coworkers say?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, that she definitely wasn’t herself lately. Said that she’d been acting agitated since she missed a mandatory 1 o’clock staff meeting last Friday. Said it was for personal reasons.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the same time that Amy stopped calling her sister. Ryan, can you look into her emails and phone calls? I want to know what was going on with her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. There’s something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right over there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that what I think it is in her hand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Poisoned apple?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s Snow White.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like we’ve got a fairytale killer on our hands.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Her medical alert bracelet got us an ID. She’s Kristina Curtis, 25. Lives on the Upper East Side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does she have next of kin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, her husband. His name’s Noah Curtis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I need you guys to take point on the interview. Find out what he knows about this and see if Kristina was connected to the other victim.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, if our killer is dressing our victims in these costumes, I bet we can ID the manufacturer and find out where he got them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a good idea. You run with it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, here it is. “White as snow, red as blood, black as ebony.” This guy is quoting directly from Grimm’s original Snow White.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our victims aren’t reenacting the fairy tales. The killer is.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Only this woman didn’t die from the poison apple. She has the same injection marks as Amy Morgan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have time of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Between 5 and 7AM this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he kills Red Riding Hood and 6 hours later he strikes again? That’s a pretty quick turnaround.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s all the markings of a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah … but technically you have to murder 3 times to be a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, let’s make sure he never gets there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When did you last see your wife, Mr. Curtis?

utterance.speaker: NOAH CURTIS
utterance.content: Just before 5AM when she – she left for her jog. She – she gave me a kiss goodbye and that was the last time I saw her. I – I – I can’t believe she’s gone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Curtis, this run she took. Who else knew she was going?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Other joggers in the park, I guess. She – she went every morning, even in the snow. She – she never missed a day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She have problems with any of the other joggers?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: No. Not that she told me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did she ever mention being followed, or watched?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: You’re saying someone was stalking her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Under the circumstances this doesn’t look like a random attack. What did your wife do for a living?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: She owned an art gallery on Fifth Avenue. It was family owned. She took it over from her dad.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You ever seen this woman before? Or heard the name Amy Morgan?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: No, I don’t think so. Why? Who is she?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s another victim, Mr. Curtis. Could she be an acquaintance of Kristina’s?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: I don’t recognize her. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you notice anything unusual about Kristina lately? Her state of mind, maybe? Or something she said or did?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: There was something strange last week. We were supposed to have lunch on Friday, but she didn’t show. She called later to say she went to the art gallery for a last minute emergency.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Last Friday? Was your lunch as 1PM?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah it was. W-why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Kristina lied to her husband about why she missed their lunch. She wasn’t at the art gallery last Friday. They don’t know where she was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so of both our victims were unaccounted for at exactly the same time shortly before they got killed. So where did they go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re still working on it. Excuse me. Yeah, Ryan here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe they knew each other.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, their families said they didn’t know each other. They had completely different careers and lived in different parts of town. It seems like their lives never really intersected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, until they both died at the hand of the same killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why these two women? And why fairy tales? Did the killer have some sort of random obsession or was there a deeper meaning behind all of it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I think he’s trying to tell a story with these bodies, I just don’t know what it is yet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe it’s about money. Turns out, Kristina raided her trust account. Guess how much she took out? $50,605 dollars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So both victims go AWOL on Friday and both pull out the exact same amount of cash? That’s not a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is a connection. Can you get a hold of Kristina’s family? See if they know why she might have needed that money.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll retalk to the husband.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, what’d you find out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I might have found the pathway to our killer. Those Snow White and Red Riding Hood outfits? They were made by the same manufacturer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where they were sold?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m still waiting for a list of stores that carry the costumes, both online and brick and mortar. Should have some answers by the morning.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: This just doesn’t feel right, Marcus. Move that chair over there. Oh Richard! Your timing is perfect. We could use your help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Moving my furniture where I don’t want it to go?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s just temporary. We’re having a stage reading of my one woman show. Here, tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… it’s too bad you don’t have an acting studio to do this kind of thing in. Oh wait … you do.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: The little black box theater isn’t right for this, dear. It needs something much more intimate.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: It’ll be very avant garde.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Exactly. Now, I think this chair should be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweetie, you couldn’t have done something to discourage this?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: I tried, Dad. But she made me stage manager. Look, it’s not as bad as you think. Just 20 or 30 people –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And we’ll put everything back. This play means a lot to Gram. And it’s actually really good. Now I understand things about her I never did before.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: About you, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About me?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no… this space needs to be bigger. An actor needs space.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ”Richard always had a dark imagination. He was destined either to become a serial killer or a mystery writer.” Mother, really?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, it’s just a slight exaggeration.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And according to this, you’re responsible for launching my writing career by … You slept with my first publisher?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I’m sure your talent would have gotten you there eventually.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My talent did get me there. I didn’t get published because of her.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Technically I slept with him after your book was out. This is just to be more salacious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wasn’t he practically my age?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Honey, you know I’ve always loved younger men. They have so much energy, enough to keep up with me. Most of the time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to erase that image from my mind with a bottle of scotch.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, darling? I invited Beckett to the reading tomorrow night, so you two might want to make a date of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was I supposed to do? Say no?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why are you so against your mom’s play?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because she’s rewriting history. My history. Trust me, I lived through it. She’s making it sounds like it’s her own personal fairytale.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you don’t like it when someone writes their own version of your life. Interesting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, are you referring to the Nikki Heat books? Because this is completely different.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How is it different?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, for one thing – I’m not claiming what I write is actually true.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I don’t think she is, either. C’mon Castle. You said so yourself. Everyone needs a fairytale. What’s the harm in letting your mom have one of her own?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, let’s – let’s change the subject to something less likely to give me an ulcer. How about that mysterious $50,605 dollars?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, um … well, we talked to pretty much everyone close to Amy and Kristina and no one seems to know why they pulled out that money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about where they were at 1PM on Friday?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing popped on Amy’s email or phone calls. And the techs are still going through Krisitna’s computer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. Think we might have caught a break. We tracked down that website that sold the costumes. They Red Riding Hood cloak and the Snow White dress worn by our victims were shipped out 8 days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To whom? Do you have a name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, Jamie Isaacson. Lives at 11th Street and 7th Avenue. And he didn’t just order 2 costumes. There was a third in the shipment as well. For Sleeping

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sleeping Beauty? He’s gonna kill again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if we get to him first.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jamie Isaacson! NYPD! Open up!

utterance.speaker: SWAT
utterance.content: Go, go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Room clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All these freaky dolls, just like I imagined this guy’s lair.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ever since Chucky I haven’t been able to look at a doll.

utterance.speaker: SWAT
utterance.content: Detective!

utterance.speaker: JAMIE ISAACSON
utterance.content: Did you have to knock down my door?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ma’am, we announced ourselves.

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: I was coming. I don’t move as fast as I used to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ma’am, do you know a Jamie Isaacson?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Of course I know a Jamie Isaacson. I’m Jamie Isaacson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You –

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Candy? It’s very good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No thanks. Mrs. Isaacson, does anyone else live here?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: No, dearie. Nobody else lives here. Just me and my friends.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you have any family that checks on you? Healthcare workers?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Other more … um… human friends?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Well mostly it’s just us. Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you receive a package in the mail last week, Mrs. Isaacson?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Oh, I receive packages all the time. Molly and Abigail are new arrivals. Aren’t they gorgeous?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, they are.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about a delivery of fairytale costumes?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Fairytale costumes?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to our records, you ordered three from a website last week.

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Well that’s just ridiculous. What would I do with fairytale costumes?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can’t imagine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you didn’t order any costumes from the internet?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Do I look like someone who has a habit of wasting money? I- I’m on a fixed income.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I … happen to notice you don’t have a doorman for this building. So where are your packages left?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: By the mailbox in the lobby.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mrs. Isaacson, did you notice any uh… unusual charges on your credit card? Anyone have access to it?

utterance.speaker: JAMIE
utterance.content: Well, not unless they’re digging for gold. Can’t be too safe these days.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So UPS confirms a package of costumes was dropped off at Mrs. Isaacson’s lobby but nobody signed for it – per buyer’s instructions.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s some more bad news. No security cameras inside the lobby or outside, and from what we can tell, the building’s not terribly secure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer probably knew that, that’s why he used it as a delivery drop.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well if he knew the old lady’s credit card number, maybe he knew her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could be. Could be he just found her credit card statements in the trash. It’s old school, but it’s effective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, for all we know he’s targeting Sleeping Beauty as we speak.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I got something. The missing hour at lunchtime of Kristina’s last Friday? Tech found a map search on her tablet that day at 12:50PM. Walking directions to Glassman’s Café on the Upper West Side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, great. You guys go to the café, see if you can figure out who she was meeting with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In the meantime, I’m gonna get a hold of uniforms and ask them to double foot patrols in parks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only he’s not going to strike in a park this time. In the Grimm’s stories Red Riding and Snow White were found in the woods. But Sleeping Beauty …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was found in her bedroom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great, so that narrows it down to several million apartments and that is just in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn’t make sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What doesn’t make any sense?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His motive. All serial killers are expressing some psychological impulse. Somewhere deep down there’s a twisted logic to their insanity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, keep going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the original Grimm’s tales - Red Riding Hood, Snow White, Sleeping Beauty – they all end up near death but are saved at the last moment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s like he’s trying to take away our victims happy endings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Not only that, but he could have ordered any costume. But he picked these. He took great care with the details. The wolf’s claw. The apple. He chose these characters for a reason. He chose these women for a reason. I just haven’t figured it out yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whatever it is, it has to be connected to the cash they withdrew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s choosing women with healthy bank accounts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kristina and Amy both withdrew the same amount of money. Maybe our Sleeping Beauty did as well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The IRS requires banks to report any transactions over $10,000, so they would have a record of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Yeah, she was here. It was last Friday during the lunch rush, right after I spilled ketchup on my new jeans. They were 70% off. Amazing sale.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Was she by herself?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: No, it was a party of three.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Three? Do you remember who else she was with?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Two other women. I’ve never been questioned by cops before. Do you mind if I tweet about this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, uh, yes. We do mind.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This one of the women?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Yeah. Are they criminals or something? ‘cause I was getting more of an Upper East Side vibe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but this third woman might be in danger so we need to identify her as soon as possible. Do you remember if she maybe paid with a credit card? Maybe you caught her name?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Nope, they paid cash.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was anyone else with them? A man?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you notice anyone watching them?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Some of the other customers, but only because they were arguing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I kind of tried to eavesdrop, but every time I went over there they gave me the death stare. Whatever they were talking about, they didn’t want me to hear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so the IRS search reveals 10 different cash transactions between $50 and $60 thousand dollars that day. Two belong to our Red Riding Hood and Snow White. That leaves us 8. Five were made by males , leaving three women – Jessica Harper, Charlotte Boyd, and Dana Wilson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Harper and Wilson are in their 50s. They don’t fit the profile.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which leaves us Charlotte Boyd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. We were able to confirm that Kristina was here with Amy Morgan and a third woman last Friday. We think she might be our killer’s third target.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We didn’t get an ID, but we did get a pretty good description.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess. In her 20s, brown hair, brown eyes, exotic looking.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, how’d you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Charlotte isn’t answering.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her name’s Charlotte Boyd. Ryan, I’m gonna text you her address. Just meet us over there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Call an ambulance. She’s still alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. Just keep me posted on her status, thanks. So that was the ER. Charlotte is stable, but still unconscious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ketamine and oxycodone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. And without treatment her heart could have stopped. Doctor says we got there just in time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just like in the fairytale.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what, you’re Prince Charming now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if the shoe fits … No, I’m just glad we had a happy ending.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it won’t be a happy ending until evil is vanquished and locked in the dungeon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re closing in on him

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but he’s still a step ahead. I’m hoping that he left some kind of evidence behind.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We’ve done a full sweep. No sign of the $50,605 dollars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A luxury condo and that much money? What does this girl do for a living?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She worked for a real estate firm as a high end broker. If you didn’t have $10 mil to plunk down on an apartment she wasn’t your girl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so we’ve got three women, all in their 20s, all successful, all have a secret meeting last Friday and then pull the exact same amount of cash out of the bank?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe they were going in on something. Pooling their money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think we can safely rule out lotto tickets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, there’s gotta be something that we’re missing. There’s something that links the three of them together.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. Look at this. I found it at the bottom of one of Charlotte’s drawers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got our connection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amy, Charlotte, and Kristina. Our three victims.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All dressed as fairytale characters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dressed as the same characters that our killer dressed them as.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Check out the date.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 05/06/05. That’s seven years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s also the amount of money they withdrew.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, and uh … check out the back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Who’s the guiltiest of them all? If you pay you’ll live to see another day.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They were being blackmailed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so something happened on that date that connects them all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Something that lead to their murders.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So who’s the guy taking the photo?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he can tell us what happened.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU only found one set of prints on the photo. Charlotte’s. But they were able to determine that it was developed within the last two weeks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can they do that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, it’s machine processed. Like, you know, from a drugstore and there’s a control code auto printed on the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we use the code to figure out where it was processed?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, already on it. Hopefully that’ll get us who ordered the prints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This photo was taken 7 years ago. Why is it surfacing now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. You’re right about the date. Something did happen 7 years ago. There’s even a police report.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t suppose the report IDs our Prince Charming.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sure does. His name’s Owen Thomas. But he can’t be our suspect. He’s dead. He was killed 7 years ago. May 6th, 2005.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The night that the photo was taken.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s also the same night that Owen attended an underground rave. Fairytale themed. He was last seen alive at 10:45.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But … this picture was taken at 11:43.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did he die?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Internal bleeding complicated with high doses of ketamine and oxycodone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains our killer’s MO.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so he’s high on club drugs. But what caused the internal bleeding?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A car. His body was found on the side of the road. The ME wrote it up as a hit and run. There were no witnesses so the trail went cold. They never solved the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s “I Know What You Did Last Summer”. Who’s the guiltiest of them all. The killer thinks that one of these women is responsible for his death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe they are. This photo proves that they were the last ones to see him alive, yet none of them gave statements to the cops.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why are the murders happening now, 7 years later?

utterance.speaker: BECKTT
utterance.content: Well maybe after all these years someone found this photo. Esposito, can you look into Owen’s family and friends? Someone might be trying to get payback for his death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Yeah, we’ll be right there. Sleeping Beauty just woke up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlotte? I’m Detective Beckett, this is Mr. Castle. Do you feel well enough to answer a few questions?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What can you tell us about the attack?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: I was at my computer, just listening to music, and the next thing you know I’m being pushed to the floor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see who did it?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: No. They’re saying – they’re saying that I was drugged. Why would someone do this to me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlotte, I think you know why. All three of you received a copy of this photo. Amy and Kristina weren’t as lucky as you. They didn’t make it.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: But we did what he asked. We paid him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does he have on you? What happened to Owen that night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlotte?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: It was just some stupid fairytale rave. Um … we were just looking to dance and have fun. And Owen had scored some Special K that hit us pretty hard, but Kristina had some of her mom’s oxy and said it would even us out. Somehow we ended up in Amy’s car. That’s where this picture was taken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did Owen end up on the side of the road?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: He was having some seriously bad hallucinations, just screaming and grabbing at us. So we pulled the car over and we made him get out. We just figured he’d walk back to the rave. But it was all over the news the next morning, that – that there’d been a hit and run, that he’d been killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn’t you come forward?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: We were just kids then. We were scared out of our minds. Y- you have to understand, we had a lot to lose. We came from good families, we’d been accepted into college, we’d – we made a pact, we said we wouldn’t tell anyone what happened that night and that we’d never see each other again. I’m not excusing how we handled it. We were stupid, but we didn’t do anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well someone thinks you did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did you do with the money?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: The note said to put it in a dumpster at Bleecker and Thompson. We didn’t want some scandal messing up our lives, so we did it. We paid. So why did he come after us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so Bleecker and Thompson. There are no security cameras at the drop site and so far no witnesses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He covered his bases.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know. It’s really starting to piss me off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and you get cute when you get angry. But not when you get angry with me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So I took a look at Owen’s family. I think I found someone with motive. Turns out he has an older brother. And apparently they were close.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any connection to our victims?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh yeah. See for yourself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, that’s Leslie’s husband Darren.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Owen’s brother is married to our first victim’s sister?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are the odds, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Darren somehow found out that his wife’s sister was responsible for his brother Owen’s death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe the families just knew each other socially. It doesn’t mean that Darren’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That doesn’t, but this might. CSU tracked down where the photo was processed. It’s from a roll of film and the guy who dropped it off had three copies made.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And does the guy’s description match Darren’s?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Even better. They had security cameras.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s him.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: I got here as fast as I could. So, is there any news? Did you find out who did this to my sister?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, first let me ask, what was Amy’s relationship with your husband’s brother? Owen.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: They were high school friends. We all were. What does this have to do with Amy?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Owen died years ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You ever see this before?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: No. That’s Amy. And that’s Owen. These two I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s from the night that he was killed.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your husband Darren had it printed up 2 weeks ago. Do you have any idea how he got it?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Last month we were cleaning out my dad’s attic and found a camera with a roll of film inside. Darren thought it’d be fun to see what was on it.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: You don’t think he had anything to do with Amy. Do you?

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: I don’t know what you guys are talking about. I didn’t blackmail anybody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, so then you don’t recognize this photo.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Absolutely not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then, this isn’t you, is it Darren.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can only imagine how you must have felt. After all these years realizing your own sister-in-law might be involved in your brother’s death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found the cash in your storage locker in Queens. $151,815 dollars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which by wild coincidence is exactly $50,605 dollars times 3.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Owen was high. He was messed up. They knew that and what did they do? They left him there. They left him and he died like roadkill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could have gone to the police.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Because they did such a bang up job the first time around? I just wanted them to pay something for what they did. And I was even going to use the money to set up a scholarship fund in Owen’s name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? A scholarship fund? And what’s your spin on murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The money wasn’t enough. You wanted revenge. You wanted them to die, just like your brother, dressed in fairytale costumes, OD’ing on the same drugs he did.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: What? No. I don’t know who killed them, but it wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s gonna be tough to believe, Darren. You had motive, to blamed them for Owen’s death, and you just admitted to blackmailing them.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: I want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course you do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Darren doesn’t need a lawyer. He needs a miracle. His wife told Ryan that he wasn’t at the house when the murders were committed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that’s it then.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, for this case. We did everything but tie a bow on it for the DA.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right this way Ms. Morgan.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Is it true, Darren? Is it true? Look me in the eyes and tell me it’s not true!

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: I didn’t hurt anyone.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: You blackmailed my sister! You lied to me!

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: No, no, no. Listen. I’m telling you the truth, okay? I didn’t kill anyone. I just wanted them to pay.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Who would do it then? You had the picture.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: No, no. Babe, I swear. I swear, babe.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: No. Get away from me.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Listen! Les!

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Stay away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Murder does more damage to the living than to the dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. All because of a terrible secret.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well secrets are like time bombs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eventually they … explode.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know Castle, I’m not saying I condone what Darren did, but I do understand it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I understand wanting revenge. The way he went about it doesn’t add up, though.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, blackmail is revenge from a distance. Murder is up close and personal. It doesn’t make sense he would do both.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t underestimate him. I mean, the only reason that he copped to blackmail was to avoid murder charges. And like any psychopath he’s a great actor. Oh, speaking of –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Psychopaths or actors?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was thinking about your mom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, so a little of both.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we can make the play.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? So you want to venture into the dark scary woods?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry Castle, I got a gun. I’ll protect you from the Big Bad Wolf.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’d use your gun on my mother? I’m touched. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh wow, Castle. This is quite the soiree.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a family trait. We tend to go big.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could you … excuse me a moment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You came.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It means so much to me, darling.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She was worried you wouldn’t make it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Break a leg, Mother.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We have a schedule to keep. Curtain in 2 minutes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I can’t get this bow straight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Allow me, allow me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah… maybe I should have Alexis do it. I mean, how many bows have you tied in your lifetime?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I only tie my shoes every day, if you remember. You taught me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, ah. True.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The bow. The bow was tied incorrectly.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I told you we should have had Alexis do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not you bow. The other bow. The bow on her costume. We arrested the wrong man.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: What? I don’t understand. So you’re saying Darren didn’t do it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he’s guilty of blackmail, but that’s as far as it goes.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: So what if the killer’s still out there. What if he comes after me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won’t. We have officers outside 24/7. We’ll find him, Charlotte. We just um… we need a bit of your help.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: Of course. Whatever I can do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we think that the key to finding the real killer is through understanding exactly what happened the night of Owen’s death. Can you answer a few questions?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, I guess so, though I’m pretty sure I told you everything I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well last time we spoke, you said that everyone was in Amy’s car?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who was driving?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: She was. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we did a little bit of checking. The day after Owen died Amy brought her car to a body shop. She had a broken grill and a dented bumper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea how she got those dents?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Charlotte, what really happened that night? Did Owen try to get back into the car? Maybe Amy panicked? Accidentally hitting him as she drove away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlotte.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: I begged Amy to go back. Kristina and I both did, we begged her, but she just kept driving. She didn’t mean to hurt him. It was just an accident. That’s the truth. That’s what really happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take a look at how the bows are tied on the victim’s costumes.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: What about them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well the killer tied these bows after the victims were drugged. See how they look? How the loops are pleasingly horizontal? Now, look at the bow on your Sleeping Beauty outfit. See how the loops are vertical? That’s a little weird. I mean, if the killer tied all three bows, why would yours be different?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s because you tied all three bows. This one is different because you tied it on yourself, behind your back.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: No. I was attacked. I’m a victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet your doctor said you received half the dose of oxy that the other girls got. A nonlethal dose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How soon after we pulled up outside of your building did you give yourself that shot?

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: This is crazy. Why would I fake an attack on myself?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So no one would suspect you of silencing the only two witnesses to your crime.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At the time, Kristina and Amy were willing to bury your secret, but then this photo showed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, how long could you expect them to keep the secret? Especially since you were at fault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All you could think about was the scandal. Jail. How it would ruin your life. All because Kristina and Amy knew the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlotte, you were behind the wheel in Amy’s car. It was you that hit and killed Owen.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: No, Amy was driving. I told you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why did you pay for the car repairs?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have the receipt.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: You don’t know what happened that night. You can’t prove that I hit Owen and you can’t prove that I killed Amy or Kristina.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes I can. Your firm handled the reverse mortgage of an old woman named Jamie Isaacson. She paid closing costs with her credit card. That’s the same credit card that you used to pay for all three costumes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlotte Boyd, you are under arrest for the murders of Amy Morgan, Kristina Curtis, and the wrongful death of Owen Thomas.

utterance.speaker: CHARLOTTE
utterance.content: The bows? Seriously?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s actually the perfect fairytale villain. Like the Big Bad Wolf she disguised herself as innocent, but like Snow White’s Evil Stepmother she was willing to do anything, even kill, to protect her image.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: After all these years maybe Owen’s family can have some closure about his death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but at what cost? Two women are dead, Darren’s still being charged with blackmail, and I’m sure his marriage is over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that’s why we need fairytales in the face of too much reality to remind us that happy endings are still possible.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah … see you in the morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Later. Speaking of fairy tales, my mother is ready to give her encore performance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time to go back into the woods?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still got your gun?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It was the opportunity of a lifetime. The chance to originate the Wicked Witch on Broadway. But it would mean being away from home 6 nights a week, 2 matinees … huh. What was I to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Realize that none of it ever happened.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Francis Bacon once wrote, “He who hath children hath given hostages to fortune.” Well, if I was a hostage, then my son Richard was my captor, my enslaver.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I’m right here.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I turned down the role. Turned my back on fortune. And it was the best career move I ever made, for an even greater role came my way. A part, perhaps the greatest role that I have ever played.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That of mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right, that is sweet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Shhh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Now, if Richard had only been able to embrace the role of son with the same level of commitment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And into the woods we go.
